comment.author: 51039755@N05
comment._content: Appropriately for a Scottish site: 759, D17, "Dinnaken", OIC Lt Hastie which was knocked out on 15th Sept 1916 (the first day tanks were used) whilst returning from it's famous successful attack along Flers High Street. "Dinnaken" served as an infantry HQ for several weeks. The tank was eventually recovered and converted to a radio tank which tried to come into operation on 31st July 1917 the first day of the third Battle of Ypres. Source: sites.google.com/site/landships/home/lists/listofmkimalet...
